[h1][u]Half Life 2[/u][/h1]

[h1][u]The Good[/u][/h1]
[i]+Amazing story with characters you care about and a gripping plot line.
+Fun weapons.
+Good progression.
+Interesting characters.
+Brilliant level design.
+Great graphics that hold up in 2018.
+Long story (12-20 hours).
+Good community.
[/i]

[h1][u]The Bad[/u][/h1]
[i]-I encountered a few glitches that killed me, this is nitpicky though and it was only 3 or so times.
-If you know the plot the game is a lot less enjoyable. Not the game's fault. If you can, play through without spoilers.
[/i]

[h1][u]Conclusion[/u][/h1]
[i]Amazing game, I wish modern FPS games were more like this, there are sad moments, funny moments and downright terrifying moments. [spoiler]Maybe I'm just a pussy but Ravenholm was downright scary.[/spoiler] I suffered many unintentional jumpscares when I turned around and was faced by an enemy haha.[/i]

[h1][u]Score[/u][/h1] 
[i]9.75/10 It drags on slightly at points.[/i]

[h1][u]Buy At Full Price Or Wait For A Sale?[/u][/h1]
[i]Although it's amazing, I simply can't recommend full price since it goes for 90% off at every Steam sale, buy it then. Sell the free trading cards you get durning the sales and buy it.[/i]

This is the best game I ever played. I bought this game way after it was released. Even though it's from 2004, it has better graphics than any other game that I have played in my opinion. The first person view, the characters, and the story makes the game extremely amazing. I believe that most of this game is open source (I think that the only closed source part is the source engine itself) so this makes a great base for modders to build other first person shooters. Definitely play Half Life 1 first before playing this game as it makes the story so much better. Playing this game will make you understand why we all are asking Valve for HL3 (well, HL2 Episode 3). Rise and shine, Mr. Freeman!

I also highly recommend installing SMOD and possibly other mods after beating this game.
